page.title: 02Blockley shops
page.content: In Blockley there are seven shops. One of them is called Rochfords.It's on the edge of Station Road. It sells mainly food.The shop is near some flats. There is also a Mace which is Mr Daveys'and it also sells food.It is in the High Street. Just up the road is a cobblers. This is Mr Franklins shop and around the corner is the newsagents which is Mr Grahams.He sells cigarettes and newspapers. Down the road is an antique shop. Also there is an iron mongers owned by Mr Balhatchet.Down the road there is butchers and wool shop which belong to Mr M. Balhatchet and those are all the shops in Blockley. There used to be many other shops in Blockley but they have closed because the houses are being taken over by holiday people.
